info.description: The Bakkt Crypto Solutions API is a REST-based API that provides a platform for clients, so their investors can purchase, hold, sell, and transfer digital assets. Clients must have authorization to use the APIs, secure endpoints, and facilities to ensure safe, fast execution and tracking of orders. Users must specify all date and time units using epoch time in UTC. The URL path includes a version number to indicate major versions which retain backward compatibility to other URLs with the same version prefix.
info.title: Bakkt Crypto Solutions

get.description: This endpoint provides an easy way to ensure the dedicated API Gateway is online and ready to service requests.

200.description: If the API is in a good state, this call returns the text "ok."

default.description: If this request encounters an issue, the system provides an error code and message.

get.summary: Check the Health of the API Gateway

post.description: Use this endpoint to create new investor accounts. The client must provide an account ID that uniquely identifies the investor from other investors on the client's platform.

requestBody.description: The account request must provide the required, basic jurisdiction and biographical information about the investor to enable the investor to participate in crypto asset transactions. Bakkt validates the provided information.

200.description: This response returns the newly created account for this investor.

422.description: This response returns a validation failure with additional details about specific sections of the request that failed validation in both machine-readable and developer-friendly messages tied to fields by name.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.description: Use this endpoint to update settlement method on input account.

requestBody.description: The account settlement request must provide unique account ID and desired settlement method it needs to be updated to

200.description: Response should return status of update and input request.

422.description: This response returns a validation failure with additional details about the failed validation.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.description: Use this endpoint to upload a document and associated metadata

metadata.description:
Document metadata with the DocumentRequest schema.  Handled as a formData string rather than the typical
body reference due to the limitations of OpenAPI spec v2.

Example:
 {
    "clientDocumentId": "3fa85f64-5717-4562-b3fc-2c963f66afa6",
    "account": "myaccountnumber",
    "documentType": "DRIVERS_LICENSE",
    "description": "my optional description",
    "documentExpiration": "2023-10-04T16:34:29.446Z"
  }

document.description: Document file to upload. The Content-Type header for this formData part must be set correctly.

200.description: This response returns the full details of the document.

404.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.description: Client systems use this service to get a security token. All subsequent calls to the gateway must have the token in the 'Authorization' header and must be made over HTTPS.

requestBody.description: Submit login credentials for the system

200.description: This response returns a token to use for subsequent API calls.

401.description: This response returns if the user is not authorized to get a token.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of orders matching the specified criteria.

parameters.description: Account for which to retrieve orders
parameters.name: account

parameters.description: Open or closed orders; currently only 'true' is supported
parameters.name: isOpen

parameters.description: Order type; currently only 'LIMIT' is supported
parameters.name: orderType

parameters.description: Order time in force; currently only 'GTC' is supported
parameters.name: timeInForce

parameters.description: Restrict search to items created on or after this time
parameters.name: startAt

200.description: This response returns the orders matching the criteria.

404.description: This response returns if the system could not complete this request, because it could not find the order.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.description:
Client systems use this endpoint to submit new order instructions to buy or sell crypto on behalf of an investor.

The order processes asynchronously. The system allows duplicate submissions; however, order details must NOT change in subsequent requests. Orders are uniquely tracked for idempotency by the submitting system providing the `clientOrderId` field.

Clients can provide the amounts to purchase or sell crypto in two different ways:

`Notional` - Using the notional field, an investor may place an order for crypto given a USD amount to purchase. For example, an investor can buy $100 of BTCUSD at market price by entering 100 in the notional field.
`Absolute` - Using the quantity field, an investor may place an order for an exact amount of crypto. For example, an investor can sell 0.05 BTC for USD by entering 0.05 in the quantity field.

requestBody.description: Submits a new order to fill given the terms provided by the investor

200.description: This response returns when the order already exists.

201.description: This response returns the newly created order.

400.description: This response returns when the request to submit the order was submitted improperly.

500.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.summary: Submit an Order to Buy or Sell Crypto

get.description: Retrieve a list of orders that the Client system has submitted on behalf of their customers.

parameters.description: Event time to query from
parameters.name: startAt

parameters.description: Event time to query to. If not set, return events until now
parameters.name: endAt

200.description: order entry events response

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve an order by its `clientOrderId.`

parameters.description: Client Order ID of the order to retrieve
parameters.name: clientOrderId

200.description: This response returns the full details of the order.

404.description: This response returns if the system could not complete this request because the order could not be found.

get.summary: Retrieve an Order by Client Order ID

post.description: Use this endpoint to submit a request to cancel an order. Requests to cancel orders are subject to the status of the order and if the order has not already processed.

parameters.description: The `clientOrderId` of order to cancel (submitted when the order was originally created)
parameters.name: clientOrderId

requestBody.description: Additional information regarding the order to cancel

200.description: Success

400.description: This response returns if the order could not be found to cancel it.

404.description: This response returns if the system could not complete this request, because the system could not find the order.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounteres an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.summary: Submit a Request to Cancel an Order

200.description: This response provides the deposit receive address response.

400.description: This response returns if the request to retrieve the address is improperly submitted.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

parameters.description: Restrict search to transfers started on or after this time
parameters.name: startAt

200.description: This response returns a list of transfers meeting the specified criteria.

400.description: This response returns if the request to submit the order is improperly submitted.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

parameters.description: The wallet address to lookup the name of the vasp for.
parameters.name: receivingWallet

parameters.description: The currency of the wallet address to lookup the name of the vasp for.
parameters.name: currency

200.description: This response returns a list of transfers meeting the specified criteria.

404.description: This response returns if a vasp name cannot be found for the provided wallet address.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

get.summary: Lookup the name of a vasp associated with a wallet address.

post.description: Use this endpoint to verify that a wallet address is valid prior to using it in a transfer request.

requestBody.description: Request containing the information about the wallet address the client would like to verify.

200.description: This response returns the validity of the provided wallet address.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.summary: Verify that a wallet address is valid prior to using it in a transfer request.

post.description: This endpoint initiates a withdrawal from the investor's positions to a wallet on the blockchain. This action requires users to request a fee estimate first.

requestBody.description: Information required to complete the withdrawal

200.description: This response returns the result of the withdrawal attempt.

400.description: This response returns if the request to submit the withdrawal request is improperly submitted.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.description: Withdrawing coins from an investor's crypto account may impose fees. Clients should request a fee estimate detailing those fees and present it to investors for confirmation prior to completing a withdrawal. Clients must then use the ID of the fee estimate to submit a withdrawal. The terms of the fee estimate are based on the underlying crypto networks' market conditions and the system honors them up to a certain grace period after generating them. After the grace period, clients must request a new fee estimate to conduct the withdrawal. Requests for estimates have no associated cost.

requestBody.description: Details required to identify the type and amount of crypto to withdraw.

200.description: This response returns the estimated fees required to conduct this withdrawal.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

post.summary: Retrieve a Fee Estimate to Complete a Withdrawal

get.description: Use this action to proactively request the status of a previously submitted withdrawal request. Bakkt provides this service as a convenience to ask about specific withdrawals. Since Crypto systems must confirm withdrawals on the blockchain, the request always has a network-dependent time lag from the moment a user submits a withdrawal on chain until the transfer completes. While client systems may use this service to ask for the latest update for a given transfer, Bakkt encourages clients to rely on the transfer websockets mechanism to receive timely updates to transfers as they post to Bakkt systems and move through the blockchain.

parameters.description: The client transaction ID of which to query the status
parameters.name: clientTransactionId

200.description: This response provides the withdrawal status.

404.description: This response returns if the system can not complete this request, because it can not find the withdrawal.

default.description: This response returns if the system encounters an unexpected error while handling this request.

CIPClearanceState.description:
`PENDING` - The CIP check is waiting to be processed
`IN_PROGRESS` - The CIP check is being processed
`ACCEPTED` - The CIP check result was good
`INDETERMINATE` - The CIP check result was indeterminate. Customer should review and update their account information
`REJECTED` - The CIP check result was rejected. Customer should review and update their account information
`FAILED` - The CIP check could not be processed. Please contact us to resolve this issue

CancelRequest.description: A request to stop attempting to serve an order; a `clientOrderId` is identified alongside this request object in order to target a specific order to cancel

id.description: An ID that uniquely identifies a request to cancel

receivedAt.description: The time the request to cancel the order was received

ClosedLot.description:
### Closed lot details.

Closed lots are derived from the interaction of opening and closing transactions.  Each closed lot is associated with one opening transaction and one closing transaction.  These relationships are maintained by the system at all times.

Closed lots are uniquely identified via the combination of "openTagno" and "closeTagno", containing the "tagnos" of that lot’s opening and closing transactions respectively .  When a single closing transaction spans multiple open lots, multiple closed lots result, each with the same "closeTagno" value but with sequential "closeSeqno" values (indicating the order in which the closing transaction was applied to open lots).

*It is not possible to create or modify lot information directly - although applications may appear to permit operations on open/closed lot objects, submitted changes are applied to the related underlying transactions.*

closeCommission.description: Commission on disposal, prorated per QTY (0 for non-taxable disposals).

closeDateTime.description: End date of unadjusted holding period.

closeFees.description: Total fees on disposal, prorated per QTY (0 for non-taxable disposals).

closeFxRate.description: Closing transaction spot foreign exchange rate to USD.

closeInterest.description: Interest on disposal, prorated per QTY (0 for non-taxable disposals).

closeIseType.description: Closing transaction sub-type (indicates specific business event disposing this lot - list can be provided).

closeNet.description: Net proceeds (cost for shorts) of disposal, in indicated currency, exclusive of interest, adjusted for option premium paid or received, unadjusted for wash sales.

closeNetBase.description: The net expressed in the account's base currency - adjusted using the closeFxRate.

closeOptionPremiumAdjustment.description: Adjustment to closeNet due to premium paid or received, when lot closed via option exercise/assignment (0 when lot not disposed via option exercise/assignment).

closePrice.description: Execution price on disposal (0 for non-taxable disposals).

closeSeqno.description: Sequence number of one to many closed lots generated by the closing transaction.

closeSettlementDate.description: Date on which closing transaction settles (set to closing transaction TRADE_DATE for non-taxable adjustment activity).

closeTagno.description: Closing transaction tagno, used with openTagno as unique closed lot identifier.

coveredIndicator.description: Indicates covered/noncovered status of shares disposed.

createdDatetime.description: Timestamp of closed lot creation in the cost basis system.

externalClosedLotId.description: External single-key closed lot identifier (pass-through value -- may appear on multiple closed lot records in sublot-level extracts when wash-sale adjusted shares are disposed).

fiAcquisitionPremiumAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for amortized acquisition premium as of close date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiBondPremiumAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for amortized  bond premium as of close date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiDeminimisMarketDiscount.description: De minimis market discount amount, NOT included in cost (0 for non-debt lots).

fiDeminimisOid.description: De minimis OID amount, NOT included in adjusted cost (0 for non-debt lots).

fiMarketDiscountAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for accrued market discount as of close date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiOidAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for accrued OID as of close date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiPrincipalPaymentAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for principal payments as of close date (0 for non-debt lots).

gainLoss.description: Realized gain/loss amount for taxable disposals, in USD, unadjusted for wash sales (set to 0 for non-taxable disposals).

lastModifiedDatetime.description: Timestamp of most recent modification in the cost basis system (null if un-modified).

longShortIndicator.description: Indicates lot side, regardless of sub-account.

openAverageCostIndicator.description: Indicates average basis acquisition ("false" = Cost Basis, "true" = Average Basis).

openCommission.description: Commission on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

openDateTime.description: Start date of unadjusted holding period.

openDrpIndicator.description: Indicates acquisition under dividend reinvestment plan ("false" = Non-DRP, "true" = DRP).

openFees.description: Total fees on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

openFxRate.description: Opening transaction spot exchange rate to USD.

openInterest.description: Interest on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

openIseType.description: Opening transaction sub-type (indicates specific business event disposing this lot - list can be provided).

openNet.description: Cost basis of shares (proceeds for shorts), adjusted for corporate actions, return of capital, liquidations, option premium paid or received, OID/premium/discount, and gift transfers, in indicated currency, exclusive of interest, unadjusted for wash sales.

openNetBase.description: The net expressed in the account's base currency - adjusted using the openFxRate.

openOptionPremiumAdjustment.description: Adjustment to openNet due to premium paid or received, when lot opened via option exercise/assignment (0 when lot not acquired via option exercise/assignment).

openPrice.description: Execution price on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

openTagno.description: Opening transaction tagno, used with closeTagno as unique closed lot identifier.

parentOpenTagno.description: Parent lot identifier, i.e. openTagno of lot from which shares represented by this closed lot had originated due to a corporate action or transfer event (blank for non-child lots).

purchasedAwayIndicator.description: Indicates shares originally purchased away from the firm.

quantity.description: Quantity of disposed shares (positive value regardless of long or short disposal).

term.description: Capital gains term, unadjusted for wash sales.

transferControlNumber.description: Back-office control number for transferred in shares (blank for non-transferred shares).

transferFmvAmount.description: Fair market value of transferred in shares on transferValuationDate, in indicated currency, prorated per QTY (blank when not supplied and for non-transferred shares).

transferFmvFxRate.description: Exchange rate to USD on transferValuationDate (blank when not supplied and for non-transferred in shares).

transferValuationDate.description: Date-of-gift for gift transfers, date-of-death or other valuation date for inheritance transfers (blank for other transfer types and non-transferred in shares).

ClosedLot.title: Closed Lot

ClosedSublot.description:
### Closed sublot (includes wash sales) details.

The closed lots contain information unadjusted for wash sales.  The closed sublots represent closed lots that have been "split" and adjusted for wash sales.  Sublots have more complicated entity relationships and key associations versus the non-wash sale adjusted lots.  

In general, wash sales arise when shares are taxably disposed at a loss and within a period of 30 days before or after disposal substantially identical shares are acquired.  When a wash sale condition exists, the loss is disallowed, the basis of the acquired shares is increased by the amount of the disallowed loss, and the holding period of the acquired shares is adjusted to include the holding period of the shares sold.  

Sublots represent the portion of a lot to which a particular wash sale adjustment has been applied.  Since wash sales most often result from the interaction of loss and acquisition activity with un-equal share quantities, there may be one to many sublots per lot.  When a lot is partially adjusted, the remaining unadjusted shares are also represented as a sublot.  For consistency, the sublot-view also represents fully unadjusted lots as sublots.  There will therefore always be at least one sublot per lot.

When lots are directly adjusted for wash sales, the intuitive relationships between transactions and lots is obscured and it frequently becomes impossible to discern how a particular set of lots (sublots) resulted from a given pattern of activity.  Account holders and client-service personnel will see little or no relationship between trading activity and the resulting lots (sublots).  To address this issue, the system maintains both lot and sublot views of open and closed lot information at all times.  "openTagno", "closeTagno", and "closeSeqno" are populated as in the sublots, but since lots may have been split into multiple sublots due to wash sales, identical key values may appear in multiple records.  To uniquely identify sublots, these keys must be combined with the sublot identifiers.

"closeSublotId", a globally unique key for closed sublots, is provided as an alternate means to directly identify closed sublots.  This identifier is generated internally by the system.

CurrencyAllocation.description: Summary of details pertaining to a currency allocation request

createdAt.description: Date at which the currency allocation batch was submitted

id.description: Bakkt unique identifier for the currency allocation

rejectReason.description: The reason the currency allocation was rejected

CurrencyAllocationRequest.description: Currency allocation request for a single customer account

batchTransactionId.description: Client-specified unique identifier for a set of currency allocations belonging to the same batch

clientTransactionId.description: Client-specified unique identifier for the currency allocation

direction.description: Denotes whether depositing or withdrawing currency

currency.description: Crypto coin that you would like to deposit

network.description: Blockchain Network associated to currency tied to deposit receive address request

receiveAddress.description: A receive address to use to deposit coin

controlPersonCompanySymbols.description: Stock symbols of publicly traded companies for which the detailed customer is listed as a control person; comma separated

finraAssociatedEntities.description: Names of the FINRA-associated entities or FINRA-regulated broker dealers; comma separated

lastScreenedDate.description: Date the account owner was last screened for CDD data

politicallyExposedImmediateFamilyNames.description: (Full) names of politically exposed family members including parent, child, spouse, cousin, etc.; comma separated

politicallyExposedOrganizations.description: Names of the politically exposed organization(s); comma separated

createdAt.description: The time the document was uploaded to the Bakkt platform

id.description: Bakkt unique identifer for the document

DocumentRequest.description: Request to upload a document with metadata

account.description: An account number to associate with the document being uploaded

clientDocumentId.description: Client-specified unique identifer for the uploaded document

description.description: A description of the document being uploaded

documentExpiration.description: Date for which the document expires

yearsEmployed.description: Number of years customer employed with employer listed

activeWalletAddress.description: Active crypto wallet address of the Entity

dailyNotionalTradingVolumeUsdRange.description: The Entity's expected daily trading volume

dailyTransactionVolumeUsdRange.description: The Entity's expected daily transaction volume

entityFormationDate.description: The date of the Entity formation

entityLegalName.description: The legal name of the Entity

entityRegistrationStatus.description: Entity's registration status with a regulatory body

entityTaxId.description: The tax identifier for the Entity

firmAnnualNetIncome.description: The annual net income of the Entity

firmLiquidNetWorthUsdRange.description: The liquid net worth of the Entity

firmTotalNetWorthUsdRange.description: The total net worth of the Entity

investmentExperience.description: Entity's level of investment experience prior to account creation

investmentObjective.description: Entity's primary objective for investment account

operatingCountries.description: 3 letter country code as per ISO 3166 Alpha-3

items.description: 3 letter country code as per ISO 3166 Alpha-3

operatingIndustry.description: The Nature of Business (industry) of the Entity

subjectToAMLRegulations.description: Whether the Entity is subject to AML regulations

code.description: This code represents an HTTP style error code. Error codes in the 4xx range indicate errors made in the way the client made the request. Error codes in the 5xx range indicate errors that the Apex Crypto system encountered in handling the request.

message.description: This error message provides additional insight into the nature of the error encountered.

Execution.description: An execution captures the results of an attempt to fill an order. There may be zero or more execution reports associated with an order to track its attempts to purchase or sell a crypto asset.

commission.description: In order to ensure that any configured minimum trade fee is met by any trading scenario, the first execution fill is charged the minimum fee. The Apex Crypto system maintains a running total of any bps commission charges as other fills are executed for that order. Once the minimum fee has been satisfied by the bps commission charges for all of the fills on the order, the bps commission charges apply to any subsequent fills.

id.description: A unique identifier for the execution report

price.description: The price at which the execution filled

quantity.description: The amount that was filled in this execution

tradeDate.description: Trading date the execution was completed on

amount.description: Net quantity of unhedged orders for the currency, eg. "1.2", "-10"

calculatedAt.description: Time when the net quantity was calculated, in RFC 3339 format, eg. "2017-07-21T17:32:28Z"

FiatAllocation.description: Summary of details pertaining to a fiat allocation request

createdAt.description: Date at which the fiat allocation batch was submitted

id.description: Bakkt unique identifier for the fiat allocation

rejectReason.description: The reason the fiat allocation was rejected

FiatAllocationRequest.description: Fiat allocation request for a single customer account

account.description: Bakkt unique identifier for the fiat allocation

batchTransactionId.description: Client-specified unique identifier for a set of fiat allocations belonging to the same batch

clientTransactionId.description: Client-specified unique identifier for the fiat allocation

direction.description: Denotes whether depositing or withdrawing currency

createdAt.description: Time of submission to the Bakkt platform

id.description: Bakkt unique identifier for the gift

notional.description: Order size in approximate monetary units

quantity.description: Order size in number of product units

rejectReason.description: The reason the allocation was rejected

GiftAllocationRequest.description: Gift request for a particular customer account

clientTransactionId.description: Client-specified unique identifier for the gift

notional.description: Order size in approximate monetary units; mutually exclusive with quantity

quantity.description: Order size in number of product units; mutually exclusive with notional

middleNames.description: Customer's middle name(s). Space or comma separated.

taxIdCountry.description: Issuing country of the national identification code

minimumOrderQuantity.description: The smallest quantity of this crypto that can be bought or sold

createdAt.description: Time of submission to the Bakkt platform

id.description: Bakkt unique identifier for the allocation

rejectReason.description: The reason the allocation was rejected

clientTransactionId.description: Client-specified unique identifier for the allocation

quantity.description: Allocation size in number of product units

transactedAt.description: Transaction time of the client trade

InvestmentExperience.description: Customer's level of investment experience prior to account creation

InvestmentObjective.description: Customer's primary objective for investment account

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code of the jursidiction

orders.description: A list of currency-specific overrides to the jurisdiction status

staking.description: A list of currency-specific overrides to the jurisdiction status

transfers.description: A list of currency-specific overrides to the jurisdiction status

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code of the jursidiction

securities.description: A list of security-specific overrides to the jurisdiction status

status.description:
`OPEN` - Customer may buy and sell in this jurisdiction
`CLOSE` - Customer may only sell their existing position in this jurisdiction
`PROHIBITED` - Customer may not buy or sell in this jurisdiction

LiquidityNeeds.description: Importance of liquidity for the customer

LoginResponse.description: The response containing security token credentials to use for subsequent calls

token.description: A security token that represents a logged in client system

bpsCommission.description: Clients use this parameter to add commission (in basis points) to the investor's executed trade cost

bpsMarkup.description: Clients use this parameter to add markup (in basis points) to the investor's ordered asset price

clientOrderId.description: Client-specified unique identifier used to track, manage, and retrieve details about the order once it's submitted.

expireTime.description: Time the order expires for GTD orders

fixedCommission.description: Clients use this parameter to add fixed commission (in USD) to the investor's executed trade cost

fixedMarkup.description: Clients use this parameter to add fixed markup (in USD) to the investor's ordered asset price

notional.description: Order size in approximate monetary units; mutually exclusive with quantity

price.description: All float fields must accommodate up to fifteen significant digits

quantity.description: Order size in number of product units; mutually exclusive with notional

stopPrice.description: The stop price for stop limit order.

symbol.description: The symbol representing a crypto asset on the platform

OpenLot.description:
### Open lot details.

Open lots are derived from the interaction of opening and closing transactions.  Each open lot is associated with one and only one opening transaction.  These relationships are maintained by the system at all times.

Open lot objects are uniquely identified via "openTagno" which contains the "tagno" value of that lot’s opening transaction.

*It is not possible to create or modify lot information directly - although applications may appear to permit operations on open/closed lot objects, submitted changes are applied to the related underlying transactions.*

averageCostIndicator.description: Indicates average basis acquisition ("false" = CostBasis, "true" = AverageBasis).

commission.description: Commission on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

coveredIndicator.description: Indicates covered/noncovered status of shares disposed ("false" = Noncovered, "true" = Covered)

createdDatetime.description: Timestamp of closed lot creation in the cost basis system.

drpIndicator.description: Indicates acquisition under dividend reinvestment plan ("false" = Non-DRP, "true" = DRP).

fees.description: Total fees on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

fiAcquisitionPremiumAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for amortized acquisition premium as of specified business date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiBondPremiumAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for amortized  bond premium as of specified business date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiDeminimisMarketDiscount.description: De minimis market discount amount, NOT included in cost (0 for non-debt lots).

fiDeminimisOid.description: De minimis OID amount, NOT included in adjusted cost (0 for non-debt lots).

fiMarketDiscountAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for accrued market discount as of specified business date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiOidAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for accrued OID as of specified business date (0 for non-debt lots).

fiPrincipalPaymentAdjustment.description: Adjustment to cost for principal payments as of specified business date (0 for non-debt lots).

fxRate.description: Opening transaction spot exchange rate to USD.

interest.description: Interest on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

lastModifiedDatetime.description: Timestamp of most recent modification in the cost basis system (null if un-modified).

longShortIndicator.description: Indicates lot side, regardless of sub-account.

mktPrice.description: Market price on date of price.

mktValue.description: Market value as of the date of market price.

net.description: Cost basis of shares (proceeds for shorts), adjusted for corporate actions, return of capital, liquidations, option premium paid or received, OID/premium/discount/principal payments, in indicated currency, exclusive of interest, unadjusted for wash sales.

netBase.description: The net expressed in the account's base currency - adjusted using the lot's fxRate.

openDateTime.description: Start date of unadjusted holding period.

openTagno.description: Unique open lot identifier (opening transaction tagno).

optionPremiumAdjustment.description: Adjustment to net due to premium paid or received, when lot opened via option exercise/assignment (0 when lot not acquired via option exercise/assignment).

parentOpenTagno.description: Parent lot identifier, i.e. openTagno of lot from which this lot originated due to a corporate action or transfer event (blank for non-child lots).

price.description: Execution price on original taxable acquisition or as reported on incoming transfer statement, prorated per QTY, adjusted via applicable ratios through all applied lot replacement and/or distribution processing.

priceAvailableIndicator.description: Indicates a market price is available.

priceDate.description: Indicates date of market price used.

purchasedAwayIndicator.description: Indicates shares originally purchased away from the firm.

quantity.description: Quantity of open shares. (“Zero” open lots not included.)

settlementDate.description: Date on which opening transaction settles (set to trade date for lots established by non-taxable adjustment activity).

tradeDate.description: Date on which opening transaction occurred (typically execution date for taxable activity, process date for non-taxable transfer or adjustment activity).

transferControlNumber.description: Back-office control number for transferred in shares (blank for non-transferred shares).

transferFmvAmount.description: Fair market value of transferred in shares on transferValuationDate, in indicated currency, prorated per QTY (blank when not supplied and for non-transferred shares).

transferFmvFxRate.description: Exchange rate to USD on transferValuationDate (blank when not supplied and for non-transferred in shares).

transferValuationDate.description: Date-of-gift for gift transfers, date-of-death or other valuation date for inheritance transfers (blank for other transfer types and non-transferred in shares).

unrealizedGlAmount.description: Unrealized gain/loss amount as of price date, in USD, unadjusted for wash sales.

unrealizedGlPercent.description: Unrealized gain/loss percentage as of price date, in USD, unadjusted for wash sales.

OpenLot.title: Open Lot

OpenSublot.description:
### Open sublot (includes wash sales) details.

The open lots contain information unadjusted for wash sales.  The open sublots represent lots that have been "split" and adjusted for wash sales.  Sublots have more complicated entity relationships and key associations versus the non-wash sale adjusted lots.  

In general, wash sales arise when shares are taxably disposed at a loss and within a period of 30 days before or after disposal substantially identical shares are acquired.  When a wash sale condition exists, the loss is disallowed, the basis of the acquired shares is increased by the amount of the disallowed loss, and the holding period of the acquired shares is adjusted to include the holding period of the shares sold.  

Sublots represent the portion of a lot to which a particular wash sale adjustment has been applied.  Since wash sales most often result from the interaction of loss and acquisition activity with un-equal share quantities, there may be one to many sublots per lot.  When a lot is partially adjusted, the remaining unadjusted shares are also represented as a sublot.  For consistency, the sublot-view also represents fully unadjusted lots as sublots.  There will therefore always be at least one sublot per lot.

When lots are directly adjusted for wash sales, the intuitive relationships between transactions and lots is obscured and it frequently becomes impossible to discern how a particular set of lots (sublots) resulted from a given pattern of activity.  Account holders and client-service personnel will see little or no relationship between trading activity and the resulting lots (sublots).  To address this issue, the system maintains both lot and sublot views of open and closed lot information at all times.  "openTagno", "closeTagno", and "closeSeqno" are populated as in the sublots, but since lots may have been split into multiple sublots due to wash sales, identical key values may appear in multiple records.  To uniquely identify sublots, these keys must be combined with the sublot identifiers.

"openSublotId", a globally unique key for open sublots, is provided as an alternate means to directly identify open sublots.  This identifier is generated internally by the system.

quantity.description: Quantity of open shares. (“Zero” open lots not included.)

settlementDate.description: Date on which opening transaction settles (set to TRADE_DATE for lots established by non-taxable adjustment activity).

tradeDate.description: Date on which opening transaction occurred (typically execution date for taxable activity, process date for non-taxable transfer or adjustment activity).

transferControlNumber.description: Back-office control number for transferred in shares (blank for non-transferred shares).

transferFmvAmount.description: Fair market value of transferred in shares on transferValuationDate, in indicated currency, prorated per QTY (blank when not supplied and for non-transferred shares).

transferFmvFxRate.description: Exchange rate to USD on transferValuationDate (blank when not supplied and for non-transferred in shares).

transferValuationDate.description: Date-of-gift for gift transfers, date-of-death or other valuation date for inheritance transfers (blank for other transfer types and non-transferred in shares).

unrealizedGlAmount.description: Unrealized gain/loss amount as of price date, in USD, adjusted for wash sales.

unrealizedGlPercent.description: Unrealized gain/loss percentage as of price date, in USD, adjusted for wash sales.

OpenSublot.title: Open Sublot

Order.description: An Order represents a request to buy or sell crypto. Orders can be placed with various criteria that include, but are not limited to, how much to purchase, how long the purchase order should stand, what price is acceptable in the case of limit orders, etc. Orders are sent to one or more liquidity providers for fullfillment using a best-bid, offer-match methodology in order to acquire the best market execution for investors' orders.

averagePrice.description: The price of the order averaged across all filled quantities for the order

createdAt.description: The time the order was submitted on the Apex Crypto platform

cumulativeQuantity.description: The total amount of quantity filled for an order; if subsequent orders are filled, this value may increase commensurately

executions.description: The results of the order's attempt(s) to execute

leavesQuantity.description: In the case that your order is not yet or cannot be fully filled, this amount indicates the order's open quantity remaining

rejectReason.description: Provided when an order is rejected in the course of attempting to serve the request

working.description: True if the order is actively being worked

OrderEntryEvent.description: Order entry event, can be one of Order, OrderCancel, Execution

OrderType.description:
`MARKET` - Fill the order using current MARKET price
`LIMIT` - Fill the order matching the price constraints provided

clientOwnerId.description: Client provided unique owner id (required when multiple owners are present or national id is specified)

phoneNumber.description: Customer's contact phone number (Should be in compacted E.164 format, eg UK (+44) 1234 123456 becomes +441234123456)

token.description: This object is a security token that represents a logged-in client system.

RequestStatus.description: Status of a request, where the request is a long running operation

RiskTolerance.description: Customer's accepted level of investment risk

Side.description:
`BUY` - Buy crypto assets
`SELL` - Sell crypto assets

TimeInForce.description:
`IOC` - Fill immediately and cancel any amount that can't be filled
`DAY` - Fill order until the end of the current trading day
`GTC` - Fill order until canceled or after 90 days
`GTD` - Fill order until the good-till date

currency.description: Coin in which to withdraw; must match the estimated coin

quantity.description: Quantity of coin in which to withdraw; must match the estimated quantity

receiveAddress.description: Receive address wallet involved in the transfer

rejectReason.description: DEPRECATED, please use statusReason. If the transfer is rejected, this will explain why

statusReason.description: explains the current status of the transfer

familyName.description: The trusted contact's family (typically last) name

givenName.description: The trusted contact's given (typically first) name

middleNames.description: The trusted contact's middle name(s). Space or comma separated.

code.description: This is an open API-styled validation error code. These fields are provided so that client systems can present customized, localized messages in response to validation error types such as a required field.

field.description: This is a field that failed validation in the input object as identified by an Open API Path.

message.description: This is an open API-styled message that summarizes the validation failed. This may include Open API Dot notation, so it should be formatted before being presented to an end user. Clients should consider implementing their own custom messages driven off the code field.

code.description: This code represents an HTTP style error code. Error codes in the 4xx range indicates errors made in the way the client made the request. Error codes in the 5xx range indicates errors that the Apex Crypto system encountered in handling the request.

message.description: This error message provides a summary of the count of the validations that failed. Details about a field-level falure are provided in the validationErrors field.

validationErrors.description: The individual validation errors encountered in processing the client request. Each error should contain detail about a specific field-level validation that failed, the rejected value, and a message indicating the nature of the failure to aid in presentation to end users. The system makes a best effort to batch as many validation failures together as possible to avoid piece-meal, one-time validations.

vaspName.description: The name of the vasp associated with the provided wallet address

addressVerified.description: Indicates if the customer's address has been verified

dateOfBirthVerified.description: Indicates if the customer's DOB has been verified

executionDate.description: The date the KYC was performed

externalCaseId.description: Client-generated unique identifier associated with the KYC results for the appropriate case

manualOverride.description: Indicates account failed vendor verification but has been manually reviewed and approved

nameVerified.description: Indicates if the customer's name has been verified

taxIdVerified.description: Indicates if the customer's taxId has been verified

vendorName.description: If client is providing KYC information, this section will be filled out with the relevant details. Note that individual client implementations will vary.

address.description: Address which should be verified for correct format

currency.description: Crypto currency that the client would like to verify the address of

isValid.description: Boolean indicating the wallet address is valid or not

currency.description: Coin in which to withdraw; must match the estimated coin

feeEstimateId.description: The estimate provided for this withdrawal; this fee estimate must be recent and cannot be expired

network.description: Blockchain Network associated to currency tied to withdraw request.

quantity.description: Quantity of coin in which to withdraw; must match the estimated quantity

receivingWallet.description: Address of the wallet in which to deposit

recipientFamilyName.description: Family name of the recipient of the withdrawal

recipientGivenName.description: Given name of the recipient of the withdrawal

requestEstimateExtension.description: Using this flag allows clients to request an extension to the expiry time of the fee estimate

selfHosted.description: Using this flag allows clients to indicate that they are the owner of the receiving wallet

vaspName.description: Name of the VASP that owns the receiving wallet

blockchainHash.description: Blockchain hash for this transaction, if the transaction has already been written to the blockchain

createdAt.description: Time at which a withdrawal was submitted

fee.description: Fee for the withdrawal in coin that is taken out of the investor's account on top of the requested withdrawal quantity

rejectReason.description: DEPRECATED, please use statusReason. Reason for a reject, if any

statusReason.description: reason for the current status of the withdrawal

totalQuantity.description: The total amount of coin to move out of the investor account to make the requested coin transfer happen (i.e., equals quantity plus fee)

usdEquivalentFee.description: Fee for the withdrawal in USD

currency.description: Crypto coin that the client would like to estimate the cost for transferring

network.description: Blockchain network associated to currency tied to FeeEstimate Request

quantity.description: Amount of coin that the client would like to estimate the cost for transferring

receivingWallet.description: Address of the wallet intended to receive the coin. This is only required for withdrawals with a notional value greater than or equal to 3000.

estimatedAt.description: Time at which a fee estimate was generated

expiresAt.description: The time at which a fee expires; a withdrawal request must be tied to an unexpired fee estimation

fee.description: Estimated fee, in coin, for a withdrawal request

id.description: A unique identifier for this estimate; this identifier must be supplied when initiating a withdrawal request

totalQuantity.description: The total amount of coin to move out of the investor account to make the requested coin transfer happen (i.e., equals quantity plus fee)

usdEquivalentFee.description: Fee for the withdrawal in USD

usdRate.description: The USD price for one coin in which the estimation was created
